attributes.content: ​The Alexandria Port Authority (APA) is the governmental body responsible for managing and operating the ports of Alexandria and El-Dekheila in Egypt. The APA oversees port operations, ensures the maintenance and development of port infrastructure, and facilitates efficient cargo handling and storage services.

attributes.title: ECOWAS Centre for Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency (ECREEE)

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: ECOWAS Centre for Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency (ECREEE) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The ECOWAS Centre for Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency (ECREEE) is a Specialized Agency of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) Commission, responsible for the development and promotion of renewable energy and energy efficiency. The objectives of ECREEE are:

body.value:
The ECOWAS Centre for Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency (ECREEE) is a Specialized Agency of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) Commission, responsible for the development and promotion of renewable energy and energy efficiency.

 

The objectives of ECREEE are:

Coordination of projects and programs related to EE and RE, improving access to modern; energy services and energy security;
Sensitization and capacity building on EE and RE in the region;
Policy harmonization for the implementation of such projects in the member states;
Research and technology transfer; and
Program development and resource mobilisation.
 

ECREEE plays a direct role in realizing the third Pillar of the ECOWAS Vision 2050, focusing on Economic Integration and Interconnectivity.

 

Its efforts contribute also to realizing the objective 4 “Inclusive, and Sustainable Development” of ECOWAS Commission Management 4×4 Objectives.

 

Through collaboration with local, regional, and international stakeholders, ECREEE is committed to advancing sustainable energy development to effectively meet the energy needs of its member states.

ECREEE’s Vision
ECREEE’s Vision is to be the leading facilitator of universal access to reliable and affordable modern energy across the ECOWAS Member States.

ECREEE’s Mission
ECREEE’s Mission is to promote renewable energy and energy efficiency in the ECOWAS region through programs that generate high socio-economic impact.

 

(Source: Organisation)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Established in 1981,Skipper Ltd. has today evolved into one of the world's leading manufacturers for Transmission & Distribution Structures(Towers & Poles) in it's Engineering Products segment, a leading and respected brand in the Polymer sector as well as trusted partner for executing critical Infrastructure EPC projects. Skipper's market reach spans across 40+ countries around the globe from South America, Europe, Africa,the Middle East, South and Southeast Asia and Australia.

body.value:
Established in 1981,Skipper Ltd. has today evolved into one of the world's leading manufacturers for Transmission & Distribution Structures(Towers & Poles) in it's Engineering Products segment, a leading and respected brand in the Polymer sector as well as trusted partner for executing critical Infrastructure EPC projects. Skipper's market reach spans across 40+ countries around the globe from South America, Europe, Africa,the Middle East, South and Southeast Asia and Australia. Within India,we are a preferred manufacturer of choice for our customers pan India,from J&K to Tamil Nadu and from North East India to Gujarat.

Holistic Products that Add Value
Skipper Limited is one of the world's largest integrated Transmission Tower manufacturing companies with Angle Rolling, Tower, Accessories & Fastener manufacturing and EPC line construction. Our manufacturing capacity is the largest in India and among the top 10 in the world. Skipper Limited is a national powerhouse in the Polymer Pipe business. Under the brand name of ‘Skipper’, the company manufactures huge range of premium quality pipes and fittings, which are used in different areas such as Plumbing, Sewage, Agriculture and Borewell sectors. Additionally, it is IT enabled and a number of operations are carried out on various ERP platforms. We are fast evolving from an Eastern region to a National Brand.

Our Integrated manufacturing units, Focussed Management and Committed Production & Quality teams make us the no. 1 choice for all our customers across Products and Sectors.

Skipper means Commitment
Skipper Limited creates value for its customers by continuously improving the quality of its products through innovation and sustained growth. Skipper has more than 35 years of domain knowledge across Various Engineering Products such as Transmission Towers, Poles, Railway Eletrification Structures, Hot Rolled Sections, Polymer Pipes and Fittings.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Tata Projects is one of the most admired Technology led Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) companies in India. We have expertise in providing sustainable solutions in the execution of large and complex urban and industrial infrastructure projects while also demonstrating strong presence in refineries and petrochemical plants. We leverage our domain knowledge across various business segments to address the shift to clean energy to meet the nation’s Net Zero ambitions.

body.value:
Tata Projects is one of the most admired Technology led Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) companies in India. We have expertise in providing sustainable solutions in the execution of large and complex urban and industrial infrastructure projects while also demonstrating strong presence in refineries and petrochemical plants. We leverage our domain knowledge across various business segments to address the shift to clean energy to meet the nation’s Net Zero ambitions.

We provide ready-to-deploy solutions for semiconductor facilities, giga factories, data centres, refineries, green fuels, roads, bridges, integrated rail & metro systems, commercial building & airports, power generation, transmission & distribution systems, chemical process plants, water & waste management, and mining & metal purification systems.

Tata Projects offers one stop service covering entire life cycle of the project, from project conceptualization to operations & maintenance. It uses innovative technology solutions to offer bouquet of services which includes engineering, procurement, construction, commissioning, inspection & expediting, operations, repairs & maintenance, and shutdown services.

Over the years, Tata Projects has received several awards and recognitions for its project delivery and commitment to safety & quality.

We are a part of the TATA Group which operates in more than 100 countries across six continents, with a mission ‘To improve the quality of life of the communities we serve globally, through long-term stakeholder value creation based on Leadership with Trust’. In 2023-24, the revenue of Tata companies, taken together, was $165Billion. These companies collectively employ over 10,00,000 people.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Development Bank of the Central African States (BDEAC) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: (Also known as Banque de Développement des Etats de l'Afrique) When it was created on December 3, 1975, the BDEAC was the culmination of the project to establish a Community Development Bank within the former Customs and Economic Union of Central African States (UDEAC), to serve as an additional instrument of economic integration. The five (5) founding states, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Congo, Gabon and Chad, were joined by Equatorial Guinea in December 1983.

body.value:
(Also known as Banque de Développement des Etats de l'Afrique)

 

When it was created on December 3, 1975, the BDEAC was the culmination of the project to establish a Community Development Bank within the former Customs and Economic Union of Central African States (UDEAC), to serve as an additional instrument of economic integration. The five (5) founding states, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Congo, Gabon and Chad, were joined by Equatorial Guinea in December 1983.

Despite the transformation of UDEAC into the Economic and Monetary Community of Central Africa (CEMAC) on March 16, 1994, the main role of BDEAC remained unchanged.

We are the financial arm of CEMAC in its ambition to make the economies of member states a vast integrated zone on industrial, commercial and social levels where development disparities will diminish.

 

(Source: Bank)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: NAMCOR (National Petroleum Corporation of Namibia) is the national oil company of Namibia, with the mission of creating value to all its stakeholders across the oil and gas value chain. Our world-class exploration and production database, and oil license blocks form some of the major attractions to Namibia's hydrocarbon potential.

body.value:
NAMCOR (National Petroleum Corporation of Namibia) is the national oil company of Namibia, with the mission of creating value to all its stakeholders across the oil and gas value chain. Our world-class exploration and production database, and oil license blocks form some of the major attractions to Namibia's hydrocarbon potential.


We deliver value in the Downstream sector, through the sale of various petroleum products to different segments of the market, among them Government, parastatals and the private sector, which includes mining, construction, transport and others.
We have recently entered the Downstream retail sector and we are currently rolling out several service stations at strategic locations around the country.


We have been designated as the operator of the National Oil Storage Facility and Jetty at Walvis Bay, which upon completion will improve Namibia's security of supply of petroleum products.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Islamic Corporation for the Development of the Private Sector (ICD) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Islamic Corporation for the Development of the Private Sector (ICD) is a multilateral development financial institution that supports the economic development of its member countries. Based in Jeddah, ICD is a part of the Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) Group and was established in November 1999. With an authorized capital of $4 billion, ICD’s shareholders include the IsDB, 56 Islamic countries, and five public financial institutions.

body.value:
The Islamic Corporation for the Development of the Private Sector (ICD) is a multilateral development financial institution that supports the economic development of its member countries. Based in Jeddah, ICD is a part of the Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) Group and was established in November 1999. With an authorized capital of $4 billion, ICD’s shareholders include the IsDB, 56 Islamic countries, and five public financial institutions.

ICD’s mandate is to provide financing for private sector projects in member countries, promote competition and entrepreneurship, and encourage cross border investments. ICD also brings additional resources to projects, encouraging the development of Islamic finance, attracting co-financiers and enhancing the role of the market economy. ICD focuses on financing projects that contribute to economic development, including job creation, the development of Islamic finance, and export growth. Additionally, ICD works to foster sustainable economic growth by mobilizing capital in the international financial markets. ICD operates to complement the activities of the IsDB in member countries and also that of national financial institutions.

 

(Source: Bank)

body.value:
Alpha MBM Investments is the esteemed private investment office led by His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Maktoum bin Juma Al Maktoum, a distinguished member of the Dubai Royal Family. Based in Dubai, UAE, we are driven by a visionary purpose – to ignite transformational growth and create enduring value across industries, geographies, and economies.

 

Our Vision

At Alpha MBM Investments, our vision is to empower global progress through strategic investments that transcend boundaries. We envision a future where innovation, collaboration, and sustainable growth redefine industries, economies, and societies. With a steadfast commitment to excellence, we strive to shape a world where opportunities are unlocked and potential is realized, contributing to the betterment of communities and economies worldwide.

Mission Statement
Our mission at Alpha MBM Investments is to be a catalyst for transformational investments that create lasting value. We aim to harness the expertise of our distinguished leader, His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Maktoum bin Juma Al Maktoum, and our global network of partners to identify and nurture opportunities across diverse sectors. By bridging gaps, expanding horizons, and driving innovation, we are dedicated to realizing prosperity for our stakeholders, our partners, and the economies we engage with.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: Ecoleges is a small, but robust privately-owned environmental consultancy based in Mpumalanga.The founding of Ecoleges at the time of fundamental environmental legislative changes in 2006 was no coincidence. The founders saw an opportunity to be more than ambassadors of the environment, and actively implement the principles of sustainable development.

body.value:
Ecoleges is a small, but robust privately-owned environmental consultancy based in Mpumalanga.

The founding of Ecoleges at the time of fundamental environmental legislative changes in 2006 was no coincidence. The founders saw an opportunity to be more than ambassadors of the environment, and actively implement the principles of sustainable development.

Its members compounded their scientific understanding and experience of ecosystem functioning within the legal framework and international standards, such as the ISO 14001: 2004 EMS, to formulate a holistic and comprehensive consultancy that adds value and best practice to any project.
Since 2006, Ecoleges has endeavoured to provide cost-effective services, whilst offering the same peace-of-mind as a larger consultancy.

The latter is maintained through:

  • professional affiliations (the Southern African Auditor and Training Certification Association – SAATCA; 
  • the Grassland Society of Southern Africa – GSSA; 
  • the International Association for Impact Assessment – IAIAsa Mpumalanga), professional registrations (the South African Council for Natural Scientific Professions – SACNASP) professional indemnity continual professional development (CPD)
     

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Ministry of Finance, Ghana | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of Finance is one of the central management agencies of the civil service of Ghana. The Ministry used to be known as Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning. However, the planning function was ceded to the National Development Planning Commission in view of Article 87 of the 1992 Constitution.

body.value:
The Ministry of Finance is one of the central management agencies of the civil service of Ghana. The Ministry used to be known as Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning. However, the planning function was ceded to the National Development Planning Commission in view of Article 87 of the 1992 Constitution.

The Ministry was established under section 11 & 13 of the Civil Service Law 1993(PNDCL 327) and amended by an Executive instrument 28(E.I 28) Civil Service (Ministries) (Amendment instrument,2017) to ensure effective and efficient Macroeconomic and financial management of Ghana’s economy.

OUR VISION

To be the lead economic management institution for development and prosperity for all Ghanaians.

OUR MISSION

To ensure effective economic policy management for the attainment of macroeconomic stability and sustainable economic growth through sound fiscal policy and efficient public financial management, competent staff and robust systems for the development of Ghana.

GOAL

The goal of the Ministry is to ensure efficient and effective management of the economy towards the attainment of upper middle income status and poverty reduction.

FUNCTIONS

  • Support the development of an efficient financial sector that supports structural transformation of the economy, promotes financial inclusion and is well integrated into the global financial system.
  • Formulate, implement, monitor and evaluate macroeconomic, fiscal and financial policies for sustainable development.
  • Ensure effective mobilization of domestic and external resources.
  • Ensure efficient and effective allocation and prudent management and utilization of resources.
  • Establish and disseminate performance-oriented guidelines and deploy efficient financial management information systems.
  • Ensure commitment to transparency, probity and accountability in the management and utilization of financial resources.
  • Ensure sustainable public debt levels.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: National Social Security Fund | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The National Social Security Fund (NSSF) Uganda, a government-established entity, offers social security services to employees through contributions of 5% from employees and 10% from employers. With assets over UGX 18.5 trillion invested in fixed income, equities, and real estate in East Africa, the NSSF is regulated by the Uganda Retirement Benefits Regulatory Authority and overseen by key ministers. It aims to lead in social security by enhancing member value through innovation while maintaining prudent risk management.

It aims to lead in social security by enhancing member value through innovation while maintaining prudent risk management. Core values include customer centricity, innovation, efficiency, integrity, and teamwork, with a focus on high-quality service and improved staff experiences.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Adjaye Associates embodies David Adjaye’s belief that architecture is fundamentally a social art form, thriving on community engagement and cultural understanding. Since its establishment in 2000, the firm has been led by Adjaye’s vision of integrating cultural and contextual insights into its designs, with studios in Accra, London, and New York.

body.value: Adjaye Associates embodies David Adjaye’s belief that architecture is fundamentally a social art form, thriving on community engagement and cultural understanding. Since its establishment in 2000, the firm has been led by Adjaye’s vision of integrating cultural and contextual insights into its designs, with studios in Accra, London, and New York. Its global portfolio includes notable projects such as the Smithsonian National Museum of African American History and Culture in Washington, DC, celebrated for its cultural and architectural significance, as well as the 130 William high-rise in New York, the George Street Plaza in Sydney, the Abrahamic Family House in Abu Dhabi, and the Ruby City art center in San Antonio. The firm’s work spans residential, commercial, cultural, and civic sectors. Adjaye’s approach has garnered significant recognition, including the 2021 RIBA Royal Gold Medal, underscoring his ability to create architecture that resonates both locally and globally by addressing diverse cultural, political, and environmental contexts. His work continues to influence architectural discourse by blending deep cultural engagement with innovative design solutions

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Zhejiang Communications Construction Group | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Zhejiang Communications Construction Group Co., Ltd. (ZCCC) was established in 1953. Whilst highway construction is its main business, ZCCC has diversified into other construction areas, such as railway, port & waterway, metro, utility tunnel and house building. ZCCC also has its own Design Institute and Road Maintenance companies, enabling it to provide integrated service of “Investment, Construction, Operation & Maintenance” to its clients.

body.value:
Zhejiang Communications Construction Group Co., Ltd. (ZCCC) was established in 1953. Whilst highway construction is its main business, ZCCC has diversified into other construction areas, such as railway, port & waterway, metro, utility tunnel and house building. ZCCC also has its own Design Institute and Road Maintenance companies, enabling it to provide integrated service of “Investment, Construction, Operation & Maintenance” to its clients.

ZCCC was listed in the main board of Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2017 (Stock Code:002061). Its business covers 31 provinces, municipalities and autonomous regions in China (excluding Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan) and 20 overseas countries. The construction projects have won more than 600 awards at the provincial and ministerial level and above, including the "Zhan Tianyou Award", "Luban Award", and "National Quality Engineering Award". It has been rated as one of ENR's "World's Largest 250 International Contractors" for eight consecutive years, ranking 2023 In 2016, it ranked 60th among the top 100 comprehensive construction companies in China, 28th among the top 80 Chinese contractors, and ranked 4th among the comprehensive strength of construction companies in Zhejiang Province.
